titleStmt.title: Gadla ḥawāryāt, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
I) Gadla ḥawāryāt, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles (fols. 1ra-148vb) I-1) The Discourse of Dionysius on the Martyrdom of Sts. Peter and Paul (fols. 136vb, 139ra-vb, 1ra-7va), with colophon I-2) The Preaching of St Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 7vb-9rb) I-3) The Martyrdom of St Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 9rb-10rb) I-4) The Preaching of St James the Just (fols. 10va-vb, 11ra), incomplete I-5) The Martyrdom of St James the Just (fols. 11ra-13vb) I-6) The Acts of St Matthias and St Andrew (fols. 14ra-27ra) I-7) The Preaching of St Bartholomew (fols. 27rb-28vb, 30ra-31vb, 29ra-vb) I-8) The Martyrdom of St Bartholomew (fols. 32ra-34rb) I-9) The Acts of St Thomas, I (fols. 34rb-39rb) I-10) The Acts of St Thomas, II (fols. 39vb-43vb) I-11) The Acts of St Thomas, III (fols. 43vb-48ra) I-12) The Acts of St Thomas, IV (fols. 48ra-50vb) I-13) The Acts of St Thomas, V (fols. 50vb-54va), with colophon I-14) The Acts of St Matthew (fols. 55ra-61va) I-15) The Martyrdom of St Matthew (fols. 61vb-63vb) I-16) The Martyrdom of St Luke (fols. 63vb-67ra), with colophon I-17) The Preaching of St Philip (fols. 67ra-71va) I-18) The Martyrdom of St Philip (fols. 71va-73vb) I-19) The Preaching of St Andrew (fols. 74ra-81rb) I-20) The Acts of Sts. Andrew and Bartholomew (fols. 81rb-95ra) I-21) The Martyrdom of St Andrew (fols. 95ra-96va) I-22) The Acts of St John the Son of Zebedee (fols. 97ra-108va) I-23) The Death of St John the Son of Zebedee (fols. 108va-vb, 109ra-va, 110ra-112vb) I-24) The Martyrdom of St James the Son of Alphaeus (fols. 109vb, 113ra-va) I-25) The Preaching of St Matthias (fols. 113va-114vc, 116ra-119vb, 134ra-vb), incomplete I-26) The Martyrdom of St Matthias (fol. 120ra), incomplete I-27) The Acts of St James the Son of Zebedee (fols. 120rb-123va) I-28) The Martyrdom of St James the Son of Zebedee (fols. 123va-125ra) I-29) The Martyrdom of St Mark the Evangelist (fols. 125ra-127rb), incomplete I-30) The Preaching of St Thomas (fols. 128ra-133vb), incomplete I-31) The Preaching of St Peter (fols. 115ra-vb, 135ra-vb, 140ra-vb, 145va-vb), incomplete I-32) The Martyrdom of St Paul (fols. 141vb l.23, 136ra-vb), incomplete I-33) The Martyrdom of St Peter (fols. 145ra-rb, 142ra-vb, 141ra-vb l.23), incomplete I-34) The Martyrdom of St Thomas (fol. 147ra), incomplete I-35) The Preaching of St Judas Thaddeus (fols. 147rb-148vb, 144ra-vb), incomplete
Additio 1.

msItem.note: - For each text, the equivalent pages of Budge's Edition (BConAp I, II) and the abbreviations used by Bausi in Annali 2000-2001 (BauGaH) are given here as follows:
I-1) BConAp I, 50-66; BConAp II, 42-57; Dio in BauGaH
I-2) BConAp I, 67-70; BConAp II, 58-61; Si1 in BauGaH
I-3) BConAp I, 70-72; BConAp II, 62-64; Si2 in BauGaH

I-18) BConAp I, 135-39; BConAp II, 131-36; Ph2 in BauGaH
I-19) BConAp I, 140-56; BConAp II, 137-53; An1 in BauGaH
I-20) BConAp I, 156-83; BConAp II, 154-80; AnB in BauGaH
I-21) BConAp I, 184-88; BConAp II, 181-85; An2 in BauGaH
I-22) BConAp I,189-213; BConAp II,186-211; Jo1 in BauGaH
I-23) BConAp I, 214-22; BConAp II, 212-20; Jo2 in BauGaH
I-24) BConAp I, 223-24; BConAp II, 221-22; JcA in BauGaH
I-25) BConAp I, 225-42; BConAp II, 223-40; Ma1 in BauGaH
I-26) BConAp I,243-246; BConAp II, 241-45; Ma2 in BauGaH
I-27) BConAp I, 247-53; BConAp II, 246-52; JZ1 in BauGaH
I-28) BConAp I, 254-57; BConAp II, 253-56; JZ2 in BauGaH
I-29) BConAp I, 257-64; BConAp II, 257-64; Mar in BauGaH
I-30) BConAp I, 265-87; BConAp II, 265-86; Th1 in BauGaH
I-31) BConAp I, 7-36; BConAp II, 5-25; Pt1 in BauGaH
I-32) BConAp I, 42-45; BConAp II, 35-39; Pa1 in BauGaH
I-33) BConAp I, 37-41, 45-49; BConAp II, 26-34; Pt2 in BauGaH
I-34) BConAp I, 287-95; BConAp II, 287-95; Th2 in BauGaH
I-35) BConAp I,296-306; BConAp II,296-306; Jud in BauGaH.
- Text I-4: text missing after 10vb and before 11ra = BConAp I, 74 l.5-76 l.3.
Text I-25: text missing between 119vb and 134ra = BConAp I, 236 l.7-240 l.11; fols. missing after 134vb = BConAp I, 242 ls.10-25.
Text I-26: text missing, only the end of the text is present.
Text I-29: text missing after 127rb = BConAp I, 263 l.20-264.
Text I-30: text missing before 128ra = BConAp I,265-266l.22; text missing after 133vb = BConAp I, 279 l.25-287.
Text I-31: text missing before 115ra = BConAp I, 7-11 l.2; text missing between 135vb and 140ra = BConAp I, 17 l.9-30 l.2; text missing between 140vb and 145va = BConAp I, 33 l.4-35 l.24.
Text I-32: text missing after 141vb and before 136ra = BConAp I, 42-43 l.27.
Text I-33: 145 is in reversed position; the text on 145r continues on 142r.
Text I-34: text missing; only the end of the text is present.
Text I-35: text missing after 144vb = BConAp I,23-306.
- According to the distribution of the texts, the Gadla ḥawāryāt of MM-11 would belong to IV recension (cp. BauGaH, 83-84).
Text I-33, the Martyrdom pf St Peter, does not contain the "Discourse of Peter on the Cross" (= BConAp I, 45-49; BConAp II, 30-34).
- On 141vb l.23, the separation between the incipit of the "Maryrdom of St Paul" and the explicit of the "Martyrdom Peter" is not clear and visible.
- Some texts are followed by short supplications for the scribe, commissioner or the reader and the translator of the Ms.: 7va, 10rb, 13vb, 96va.
Note on 7va (below the colophon of Text I-1): mention and supplication for the commissioner, whose name has been erased. The name of Śärḍä Dǝngǝl is inserted over erasure in a more recent hand.

list.item: The quire structure cannot be established due to the poor condition of the Ms.

supportDesc.condition: The front board is missing; the original sewing is for the most part missing. Many fols. are missing and some are misplaced. 145 is in reversed position. The bottom right corner of the fols. is damaged by rodents. Many fols. are affected by humidity and stained with dirt; some parts of text are illegible (e.g., 140r, 146r). Some fols. are loosely held together by threads or cords (e.g., s. 113v-114r).

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.seg: Black; red (vivid red; brilliant vermillion for the name of the commissioner).

Name of the commissioner; a few lines of the incipit (or on the incipit page) of each text, alternating with black lines; the initial lines of the account proper; Ethiopian numerals; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; crux ansata and coronis or their elements.

handDesc.handNote: The handwriting is characterized by tall, thick, slightly right-sloping letters, with rounded and curved shapes. It is uncertain if more hands were involved in the writing (s. e.g., 88v and 89r, 89v and 90r).
- ጵ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, oriented to the left (e.g., 58vb l.16)
- መ (esp. in the 1st and 2nd orders) has the loops not completely separated, of triangular shape; the right loop does not rest on the ruled line
- the upper horizontal strokes of some letters (e.g., መ ሠ ወ) are usually slanted to the left
- ሎ has the loop marking the 7th order usually attached directly to the body of the letter, without the horizontal stroke
- the numerals are usually without dashes
- ፮ has the loop open, looking like “compressed” ፯ (e.g., 119rb)
- ፪ has angular and not separated loops (e.g., 12rb)
- the crux ansata and coronis (together) are used in the Ms. in the margins of some texts, marking the beginnings (s., e.g., 108v)
- sentence dividers are accompanied by paragraph signs.

decoDesc.decoNote: 7vb, 10va, 14ra, 27rb, 109vb, 120rb, 145ra, 147rb (incipit of Texts I-2, I-3, I-5, I-6, I-22; I-26, I-32, I-34): coloured (red, yellow, green or only red), ornamental band, with decorations on the top extending to the upper margin of the page; interlaces.

55rab, 74rab (incipit page of Texts I-13, I-18): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, green), ornamental band with three pendants, two at the left and right bottom corners and one at the central bottom part, all reaching the bottom of the text, and decorations on the top of the band extending to the upper margin of the page; interlaces.

95ra, 113va, 125ra, 136vb (incipit of Texts I-20, I-24, I-28, I-1): coloured (red, yellow, green), ornamental band with four short pendants at corners reaching some lines of the text below and above; interlaces.

97rab (incipit page of Text I-21): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, green), ornamental band with three pendants, two at the left and right bottom corners and one at the central bottom part, all reaching the middle of the text, and decorations on the top of the band extending to the upper margin of the page; interlaces.

list.item:
f. 54va(below the text): Mention of the commissioner. 54va: ሠርፀ፡ ድንግል፡ በዘሙኑ[sic]፡ ለዝ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘመካን፡ ዘሠረቃ፡ ወዘፈሐቃ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ወእሱረ፡ ይኩን፡ ኣሜን።
The note, written in a secondary hand, mentions the name Śärḍä Dǝngǝl. A person with the same name (over erasure) is mentioned as the commissioner of the book in the note on 7va.

- Cues for the rubricator (numerals): e.g., 19v, 20v, 21v, 22r, 26r, 64v, 65r, 66r, 75v, 78va, 79r, 85r. - Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally: 17vb, 57ra, 57rv, 58ra, 59va. - Erasure: 94ra. - Correction written over erasure: 94ra. - Pen trials: 96v. - Crude notes in a recent hand in the margins or below the text on 34v, 42v, 43r, 54v, 109v, 145v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front board is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Śärḍä Dǝngǝl is mentioned as the commissioner in the note on 7va and in some supplications formulas (e.g., 100vb, 109ra, 112va), but his name is written over erasures. Cp. also Additio 1.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
